newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: FCC proposes S$150 mln bond issue.
newsitem.headline: FCC proposes S$150 mln bond issue.

text.p: First Capital Corporation Ltd (FCC) said on Wednesday it was proposing to issue Singapore $150 million of unsecured fixed rate bonds due 2002.
It said in a statement Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd had been appointed to manage the issue.
OCBC had agreed to subscribe for the entire issue on a "bought deal" basis and would be offered for sale by OCBC through private placement, the statement said.
The bonds would be issued in a single tranche in the denomination of S$250,000 each. Each bond will bear a fixed interest rate of 5.35 percent per year, payable semi-annually in arrears.
FCC said it intended to use the net proceeds to refinance the borrowings taken to redeem the bonds due 1997, which it redeemed in May 1997.
The funds would also be used to refinance development projects at Tanjung Rhu, Bishan, Paterson Road and Bedok Reservoir Road, it said.
